businesses.question: What's the best restaurant for a special dinner at St. Armands Circle?
businesses.name: Columbia Restaurant
businesses.tagline: Oldest restaurant in Sarasota serving authentic Spanish-Cuban cuisine since 1959
businesses.description: Family-owned for 120+ years, Columbia is Sarasota's oldest operating restaurant and features the world-famous 1905 Salad prepared tableside. Located in hand-painted Mediterranean-style dining rooms with family heirlooms, offering award-winning Spanish/Cuban cuisine. Open 365 days a year with both indoor and patio seating overlooking the Circle.

reviews.featured: Sarasota Magazine recognition for authentic Cuban cuisine

businesses.question: What's the most romantic fine dining restaurant at St. Armands Circle?
businesses.name: Caf√© on St. Armands
businesses.tagline: 50-year Continental tradition reimagined with Mediterranean flair for 2025
businesses.description: Celebrating 50+ years as a Sarasota fine dining institution, now reimagined for 2025 with fresh Mediterranean influences. Located in John Ringling's original 1926 real estate office, the oldest building on the Circle. Features live piano music Friday and Saturday nights, creating the perfect romantic atmosphere.

businesses.question: What's the best casual dining with shopping at St. Armands Circle?
businesses.name: Tommy Bahama Restaurant & Store
businesses.tagline: Island lifestyle dining and shopping experience since 1996
businesses.description: Tommy Bahama's second-ever location opening in 1996, now featuring a new combined 11,000 sq ft restaurant, bar and retail store. Offers island-inspired cuisine, award-winning hospitality, and signature cocktails alongside tropical resort wear. Perfect for a relaxed lunch followed by shopping for beachy vibes and timeless styles.

businesses.question: What's the best beach near St. Armands Circle for a perfect day?
businesses.name: Lido Beach
businesses.tagline: 3,000 feet of pristine white sand just steps from the Circle
businesses.description: Less crowded than Siesta Key but equally beautiful, offering 3,000 feet of white sand with lifeguards and full amenities including the Lido Beach Pavilion. Features concession stands, outdoor showers, restrooms, and picnic tables. Famous for Florida lobster rolls at the pavilion and easy walking access to St. Armands Circle shopping and dining.
businesses.location: Lido Key (adjacent to St. Armands Circle)
businesses.priceRange: Free beach access, parking fees apply

contact.address: 700 Ben Franklin Dr, Lido Key, FL 34236

relatedQuestions: What's the closest beach to St. Armands Circle?

businesses.question: Where's the best jewelry shopping on St. Armands Circle?
businesses.name: June Simmons Jewelry at The Met
businesses.tagline: Master jeweler's collectible creations from emerging to storied designers
businesses.description: Pop into Simmons' exclusive location inside The Met for the finest collectible jewelry from emerging to legendary design houses. Browse selections from fashion jewelry to timeless gems to vintage jewels, plus discover unique pieces by master jeweler June Simmons herself. A destination for serious jewelry collectors and gift buyers.
businesses.priceRange: Luxury jewelry, wide range of price points

contact.address: 35 S. Boulevard of Presidents, St. Armands Circle

businesses.question: What's the best fashion boutique on St. Armands Circle?
businesses.name: INfluence Boutiques
businesses.tagline: Side-by-side multi-label boutiques for style-minded men and women
businesses.description: Style-minded shoppers depend on these side-by-side boutiques for expertly curated fashion edits. Features names like LNA, Wildfox, Clare Vivier, Rory Beca, Vince, The Jetset Diaries, and Nightcap. Separate men's and women's stores offer contemporary fashion that you won't find everywhere else.

contact.address: 474 & 478 John Ringling Blvd, St. Armands Circle

businesses.question: What's the best place for dessert and treats on St. Armands Circle?
businesses.name: Kilwin's Chocolates & Ice Cream
businesses.tagline: Sweet in every sense since 1947 - legendary fudge you can smell from blocks away
businesses.description: Founded in Petoskey, Michigan in 1947, offering traditional ice cream and fudge shop experience. Famous for fudge so aromatic you can smell it from blocks away - permanently embedding itself in visitors' memories of the Circle. Perfect afternoon pick-me-up between shopping and before dinner.

contact.address: 312 John Ringling Blvd, St. Armands Circle

reviews.featured: Visit Sarasota County dining guide mention

businesses.question: How should I spend a perfect weekend day at St. Armands Circle and Lido Beach?
businesses.name: St. Armands Circle & Lido Beach Perfect Day Experience
businesses.tagline: European-style shopping circle with pristine beach just steps away
businesses.description: Start with morning beach time at less-crowded Lido Beach (3,000 feet of white sand), then stroll to the Circle for lunch and shopping among 130+ boutiques and restaurants. Afternoon browsing includes the Circus Ring of Fame honoring Sarasota's big-top heritage. End with sunset dining at sidewalk cafes with European flair - all walkable within five blocks.
businesses.priceRange: Free to explore, individual purchase costs vary

reviews.featured: TripAdvisor Travelers' Choice Award - Top 10% properties
